text: Gent-Sint-Pieters railway station (, ) is the main railway station in Ghent, East Flanders, Belgium, and the fourth-busiest in Belgium and busiest in Flanders, with 17.65 million passengers a year. \- DÃ©tail du calcul : (261xNbre voyageur jours de semaine) + (52xNbre Samedi) + (52xNbre Dimanche) The station is operated by the National Railway Company of Belgium (NMBS/SNCB). ==References== Category:1912 establishments in Europe Category:1910s establishments in Belgium Category:Railway stations in Belgium Category:Ghent
title: Gent-Sint-Pieters railway station
